Description: Foot and lower wall sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery large bowl or plate with tall ring foot, convex on outer face, concave on inner face; wholly glazed, with rouletting towards the centre of the floor; inscription cut on underside; bore hole for fabric analysis.
Curator's comments: Clay analysed by M. Hughes and found to be Attic: G. Harbottle, M.J. Hughes and S. Seleem, 'The origin of black-figure Greek ceramics found in Naucratis (Nile Delta)', Archaeometry 47 (2005), 511-518; p. 513, table 1, no.19. Pencilled in interior: 972.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1821)
